WorkItem.Description: As the summary reads, node_modules should not show up as outgoing change.

Comments.Message:
I would like to contradict this, and say that our work requires this to be the case so that we can be sure that we are using the same environment across development machines.

I don't think this is such a good suggestion, if you don't want node_modules to be a change then exclude it from your repository/project.

There is an easy solution to this problem, called npm shrinkwrap (https://npmjs.org/doc/shrinkwrap.html). In addition to that, since TS team chose to not checkin the node_modules folder, the situation before and after having node_modules in .gitignore is identical.
